summary: AI/ML Infrastructure Implementation - Neural Network Consensus Optimization

Implementation Details:

1. AIConsensusOptimizer

- Implements prediction models for consensus efficiency

2. PredictiveTransactionOrdering 
- ML-based transaction optimization

- Dynamic batch size optimization based on network conditions
- ML-driven performance tuning

summary: Build API Client Service Layer for V11 Integration

content.text:
## Overview
Create a centralized API client service layer to handle all HTTP communications with the V11 backend API at dlt.aurigraph.io:9003.

## Business Value
Blocks all production functionality. Without this foundational service, no UI component can communicate with the backend.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup HTTP client using axios with TypeScript
2. Configure base URL from environment variables
3. Implement request/response interceptors
4. Add global error handling middleware
5. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
6. Configure request timeout (30s default)
7. Add request/response logging for debugging
8. Create TypeScript interfaces for all API responses

## API Endpoints to Support
- Base URL: http://dlt.aurigraph.io:9003/api/v11
- All 17 V11 endpoints

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Axios client configured with interceptors
- [ ] Environment-based URL configuration (.env files)
- [ ] Global error handling catches all API errors
- [ ] Request retry on network failures (3 retries max)
- [ ] TypeScript types for all API responses
- [ ] Request/response logging in development mode
- [ ] Unit tests for client service (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Documentation with usage examples

## Technical Details
```typescript
// Example structure
class ApiClient {
  constructor(baseURL: string)
  get<T>(endpoint: string, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  post<T>(endpoint: string, data: any, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  // Error handling, retry logic, etc.
}
```

## Dependencies
None - foundational work

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/ApiClient.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/endpoints.ts` (new)
- `/ui/types/api.ts` (new)
- `/ui/.env.example` (update)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Unit tests passing
- Integration tested with production API
- Documentation complete

summary: Implement JWT Authentication System for Enterprise Portal

content.text:
## Overview
Implement complete authentication and authorization system for the enterprise portal with JWT tokens, role-based access control, and secure session management.

## Business Value
Critical security requirement. Cannot deploy to production without proper authentication. Enables user management and role-based feature access.

## Technical Requirements
1. JWT token authentication flow
2. Login/logout UI components
3. Session management (token storage, refresh)
4. Protected route wrapper component
5. Role-based access control (RBAC)
6. API key management interface
7. User profile management
8. Password reset functionality
9. Remember me functionality
10. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) support

## User Roles
- **Admin**: Full system access
- **Validator**: Node management, consensus participation
- **Observer**: Read-only access
- **Developer**: API testing, performance tools

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Login page with email/password
- [ ] JWT token stored securely (httpOnly cookies preferred)
- [ ] Automatic token refresh before expiry
- [ ] Logout functionality clears session
- [ ] Protected routes redirect to login if unauthenticated
- [ ] RBAC restricts features by role
- [ ] Session timeout after 30 minutes inactivity
- [ ] Remember me extends session to 30 days
- [ ] Password reset via email
- [ ] MFA setup and verification (TOTP)
- [ ] User profile view and edit
- [ ] API key generation and management

## UI Components
- LoginPage
- LogoutButton
- ProtectedRoute wrapper
- UserProfile page
- PasswordReset flow
- MFASetup component
- APIKeyManagement dashboard

## API Integration
Assuming backend provides:
- POST /api/v11/auth/login
- POST /api/v11/auth/logout
- POST /api/v11/auth/refresh
- POST /api/v11/auth/reset-password
- GET/PUT /api/v11/auth/profile
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/setup
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/verify

## Security Requirements
- Passwords never logged or stored in localStorage
- JWT tokens in httpOnly cookies (not localStorage)
- CSRF protection
- Rate limiting on login attempts
- Password strength requirements
- Secure password reset tokens

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/pages/auth/login.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/reset-password.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/profile.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/components/auth/ProtectedRoute.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/contexts/AuthContext.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAuth.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/authService.ts` (new)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Security audit passed
- Unit and integration tests passing
- Documentation complete
- User acceptance testing passed

summary: Setup Global State Management with Redux Toolkit

content.text:
## Overview
Implement centralized state management using Redux Toolkit to manage global application state, API data caching, and real-time updates.

## Business Value
Enables efficient data sharing across components, reduces API calls through caching, and improves application performance.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup Redux Toolkit store
2. Create state slices:
   - auth (user, token, permissions)
   - platform (status, info, metrics)
   - transactions (list, stats, filters)
   - consensus (status, proposals)
   - crypto (status, operations)
   - bridge (stats, transfers)
   - ai (stats, config)
   - hms (stats, assets)
3. Implement selector hooks
4. Add Redux middleware for API calls (RTK Query)
5. Setup state persistence (localStorage)
6. Integrate Redux DevTools
7. Implement optimistic updates

## State Structure
```typescript
interface RootState {
  auth: AuthState
  platform: PlatformState
  transactions: TransactionsState
  consensus: ConsensusState
  crypto: CryptoState
  bridge: BridgeState
  ai: AIState
  hms: HMSState
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Redux Toolkit configured and integrated
- [ ] All state slices created with proper typing
- [ ] Selector hooks for data access
- [ ] RTK Query setup for API caching
- [ ] State persists across page refreshes
- [ ] Redux DevTools working in development
- [ ] No prop drilling in components
- [ ] Efficient re-renders (using selectors)
- [ ] Optimistic updates for mutations
- [ ] Unit tests for reducers and selectors

## Caching Strategy
- Platform metrics: 5-minute cache
- Transaction stats: 10-second cache
- Consensus status: 5-second cache
- User profile: Session cache
- Historical data: 1-hour cache

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/store/index.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/authSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/platformSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/transactionsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/consensusSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/cryptoSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/bridgeSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/aiSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/hmsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppSelector.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppDispatch.ts` (new)
- `/ui/app/layout.tsx` (modify - add Provider)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- All slices implemented and tested
- DevTools integration verified
- Performance benchmarks met
- Documentation complete

## Overview
Build infrastructure for real-time data updates using WebSocket connections with fallback to polling for metrics that require live updates.

## Business Value
Enables real-time monitoring dashboards with sub-second latency for critical metrics like TPS, consensus status, and transaction processing.

## Technical Requirements
1. WebSocket client for real-time metrics
2. Server-Sent Events (SSE) client for streaming
3. Polling service for periodic updates
4. Connection state management
5. Automatic reconnection logic
6. Heartbeat/ping mechanism
7. Data refresh strategies per endpoint type
8. Fallback to polling if WebSocket fails

## Real-Time Endpoints
- Platform status (1s updates)
- Performance metrics (1s updates)
- Transaction stats (5s updates)
- Consensus status (2s updates)
- AI optimization level (10s updates)

## Polling Endpoints
- System info (60s updates)
- Bridge stats (30s updates)
- HMS stats (60s updates)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WebSocket connection established to backend
- [ ] Real-time TPS updates (<1s latency)
- [ ] Connection status indicator in UI
- [ ] Automatic reconnection on disconnect
- [ ] Fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable
- [ ] Configurable refresh intervals per metric
- [ ] Data staleness indicators
- [ ] Pause/resume real-time updates (when tab inactive)
- [ ] Memory leak prevention (cleanup on unmount)
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures

## Connection State
```typescript
type ConnectionState = 'connected' | 'connecting' | 'disconnected' | 'error'
```

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-003 (Global State Management)
- Backend WebSocket support (may need implementation)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/websocketService.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/pollingService.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useRealTimeData.ts` (new)
- `/ui/components/ConnectionStatus.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/connectionSlice.ts` (new)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Unit and integration tests passing
- Connection stability tested
- Memory leak tests passed
- Documentation complete

content.text:

*Node Types:*
1. *Channel Nodes* - Message routing and communication

4. *API Integration Nodes* - External data ingestion (Alpaca, W.com)

- ML-based transaction optimization
- Reduces consensus rounds through intelligent ordering
- Improves overall system efficiency

3. AnomalyDetectionService
- Real-time anomaly detection system
- Monitors throughput degradation and latency spikes
- Automatic system health monitoring

4. AdaptiveBatchProcessor
- Dynamic batch size optimization based on network conditions
- ML-driven performance tuning
- Reduces latency through intelligent batching

5. AIOptimizationService
- Main ML coordinator service
- Orchestrates all AI optimization components
- Provides centralized ML management

Technical Implementation:
- Framework: DeepLearning4J, Apache Commons Math, SMILE ML
- Architecture: Java 21 + Quarkus reactive programming
- Performance Target: 15-25% latency reduction, 20-30% throughput improvement
- Files Created: 5 new AI/ML service classes
- Integration: Seamless integration with existing consensus layer

This implementation provides the foundation for ML-driven consensus optimization in Aurigraph V11, enabling intelligent performance tuning and anomaly detection.

COMPLETED: Cross-Chain Bridge Infrastructure

Implementation Details:

1. Multi-Chain Adapter System
- Created bridge adapters for 5 major blockchains:
  - Ethereum (EthereumAdapter)
  - Polygon (PolygonAdapter) 
  - Binance Smart Chain (BSCAdapter)
  - Avalanche (AvalancheAdapter)
  - Solana (SolanaAdapter)

2. AtomicSwapManager
- Secure cross-chain atomic swap functionality
- Ensures transaction atomicity across different chains
- Implements timeout and rollback mechanisms

3. BridgeTokenRegistry
- Multi-chain token management system
- Maintains token mappings across different networks
- Supports token metadata and validation

4. BaseChainAdapter
- Abstract base class for all chain adapters
- Standardized interface for cross-chain operations
- Extensible architecture for adding new chains

Technical Architecture:
- Design Pattern: Adapter pattern for chain-specific implementations
- Security: Atomic swap guarantees with timeout protection
- Scalability: Support for unlimited chain additions
- Integration: Ready for LayerZero and Wormhole protocol integration

- EthereumAdapter.java

summary: Build API Client Service Layer for V11 Integration

content.text:
## Overview
Create a centralized API client service layer to handle all HTTP communications with the V11 backend API at dlt.aurigraph.io:9003.

## Business Value
Blocks all production functionality. Without this foundational service, no UI component can communicate with the backend.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup HTTP client using axios with TypeScript
2. Configure base URL from environment variables
3. Implement request/response interceptors
4. Add global error handling middleware
5. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
6. Configure request timeout (30s default)
7. Add request/response logging for debugging
8. Create TypeScript interfaces for all API responses

## API Endpoints to Support
- Base URL: http://dlt.aurigraph.io:9003/api/v11
- All 17 V11 endpoints

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Axios client configured with interceptors
- [ ] Environment-based URL configuration (.env files)
- [ ] Global error handling catches all API errors
- [ ] Request retry on network failures (3 retries max)
- [ ] TypeScript types for all API responses
- [ ] Request/response logging in development mode
- [ ] Unit tests for client service (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Documentation with usage examples

## Technical Details
```typescript
// Example structure
class ApiClient {
  constructor(baseURL: string)
  get<T>(endpoint: string, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  post<T>(endpoint: string, data: any, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  // Error handling, retry logic, etc.
}
```

## Dependencies
None - foundational work

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/ApiClient.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/endpoints.ts` (new)
- `/ui/types/api.ts` (new)
- `/ui/.env.example` (update)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Unit tests passing
- Integration tested with production API
- Documentation complete

summary: Implement JWT Authentication System for Enterprise Portal

content.text:
## Overview
Implement complete authentication and authorization system for the enterprise portal with JWT tokens, role-based access control, and secure session management.

## Business Value
Critical security requirement. Cannot deploy to production without proper authentication. Enables user management and role-based feature access.

## Technical Requirements
1. JWT token authentication flow
2. Login/logout UI components
3. Session management (token storage, refresh)
4. Protected route wrapper component
5. Role-based access control (RBAC)
6. API key management interface
7. User profile management
8. Password reset functionality
9. Remember me functionality
10. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) support

## User Roles
- **Admin**: Full system access
- **Validator**: Node management, consensus participation
- **Observer**: Read-only access
- **Developer**: API testing, performance tools

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Login page with email/password
- [ ] JWT token stored securely (httpOnly cookies preferred)
- [ ] Automatic token refresh before expiry
- [ ] Logout functionality clears session
- [ ] Protected routes redirect to login if unauthenticated
- [ ] RBAC restricts features by role
- [ ] Session timeout after 30 minutes inactivity
- [ ] Remember me extends session to 30 days
- [ ] Password reset via email
- [ ] MFA setup and verification (TOTP)
- [ ] User profile view and edit
- [ ] API key generation and management

## UI Components
- LoginPage
- LogoutButton
- ProtectedRoute wrapper
- UserProfile page
- PasswordReset flow
- MFASetup component
- APIKeyManagement dashboard

## API Integration
Assuming backend provides:
- POST /api/v11/auth/login
- POST /api/v11/auth/logout
- POST /api/v11/auth/refresh
- POST /api/v11/auth/reset-password
- GET/PUT /api/v11/auth/profile
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/setup
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/verify

## Security Requirements
- Passwords never logged or stored in localStorage
- JWT tokens in httpOnly cookies (not localStorage)
- CSRF protection
- Rate limiting on login attempts
- Password strength requirements
- Secure password reset tokens

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/pages/auth/login.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/reset-password.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/profile.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/components/auth/ProtectedRoute.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/contexts/AuthContext.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAuth.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/authService.ts` (new)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Security audit passed
- Unit and integration tests passing
- Documentation complete
- User acceptance testing passed

summary: Setup Global State Management with Redux Toolkit

content.text:
## Overview
Implement centralized state management using Redux Toolkit to manage global application state, API data caching, and real-time updates.

## Business Value
Enables efficient data sharing across components, reduces API calls through caching, and improves application performance.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup Redux Toolkit store
2. Create state slices:
   - auth (user, token, permissions)
   - platform (status, info, metrics)
   - transactions (list, stats, filters)
   - consensus (status, proposals)
   - crypto (status, operations)
   - bridge (stats, transfers)
   - ai (stats, config)
   - hms (stats, assets)
3. Implement selector hooks
4. Add Redux middleware for API calls (RTK Query)
5. Setup state persistence (localStorage)
6. Integrate Redux DevTools
7. Implement optimistic updates

## State Structure
```typescript
interface RootState {
  auth: AuthState
  platform: PlatformState
  transactions: TransactionsState
  consensus: ConsensusState
  crypto: CryptoState
  bridge: BridgeState
  ai: AIState
  hms: HMSState
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Redux Toolkit configured and integrated
- [ ] All state slices created with proper typing
- [ ] Selector hooks for data access
- [ ] RTK Query setup for API caching
- [ ] State persists across page refreshes
- [ ] Redux DevTools working in development
- [ ] No prop drilling in components
- [ ] Efficient re-renders (using selectors)
- [ ] Optimistic updates for mutations
- [ ] Unit tests for reducers and selectors

## Caching Strategy
- Platform metrics: 5-minute cache
- Transaction stats: 10-second cache
- Consensus status: 5-second cache
- User profile: Session cache
- Historical data: 1-hour cache

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/store/index.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/authSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/platformSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/transactionsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/consensusSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/cryptoSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/bridgeSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/aiSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/hmsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppSelector.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppDispatch.ts` (new)
- `/ui/app/layout.tsx` (modify - add Provider)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- All slices implemented and tested
- DevTools integration verified
- Performance benchmarks met
- Documentation complete

## Overview
Build infrastructure for real-time data updates using WebSocket connections with fallback to polling for metrics that require live updates.

## Business Value
Enables real-time monitoring dashboards with sub-second latency for critical metrics like TPS, consensus status, and transaction processing.

## Technical Requirements
1. WebSocket client for real-time metrics
2. Server-Sent Events (SSE) client for streaming
3. Polling service for periodic updates
4. Connection state management
5. Automatic reconnection logic
6. Heartbeat/ping mechanism
7. Data refresh strategies per endpoint type
8. Fallback to polling if WebSocket fails

## Real-Time Endpoints
- Platform status (1s updates)
- Performance metrics (1s updates)
- Transaction stats (5s updates)
- Consensus status (2s updates)
- AI optimization level (10s updates)

## Polling Endpoints
- System info (60s updates)
- Bridge stats (30s updates)
- HMS stats (60s updates)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WebSocket connection established to backend
- [ ] Real-time TPS updates (<1s latency)
- [ ] Connection status indicator in UI
- [ ] Automatic reconnection on disconnect
- [ ] Fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable
- [ ] Configurable refresh intervals per metric
- [ ] Data staleness indicators
- [ ] Pause/resume real-time updates (when tab inactive)
- [ ] Memory leak prevention (cleanup on unmount)
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures

## Connection State
```typescript
type ConnectionState = 'connected' | 'connecting' | 'disconnected' | 'error'
```

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-003 (Global State Management)
- Backend WebSocket support (may need implementation)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/websocketService.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/pollingService.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useRealTimeData.ts` (new)
- `/ui/components/ConnectionStatus.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/connectionSlice.ts` (new)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Unit and integration tests passing
- Connection stability tested
- Memory leak tests passed
- Documentation complete

summary: Build API Client Service Layer for V11 Integration

content.text:
## Overview
Create a centralized API client service layer to handle all HTTP communications with the V11 backend API at dlt.aurigraph.io:9003.

## Business Value
Blocks all production functionality. Without this foundational service, no UI component can communicate with the backend.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup HTTP client using axios with TypeScript
2. Configure base URL from environment variables
3. Implement request/response interceptors
4. Add global error handling middleware
5. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
6. Configure request timeout (30s default)
7. Add request/response logging for debugging
8. Create TypeScript interfaces for all API responses

## API Endpoints to Support
- Base URL: http://dlt.aurigraph.io:9003/api/v11
- All 17 V11 endpoints

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Axios client configured with interceptors
- [ ] Environment-based URL configuration (.env files)
- [ ] Global error handling catches all API errors
- [ ] Request retry on network failures (3 retries max)
- [ ] TypeScript types for all API responses
- [ ] Request/response logging in development mode
- [ ] Unit tests for client service (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Documentation with usage examples

## Technical Details
```typescript
// Example structure
class ApiClient {
  constructor(baseURL: string)
  get<T>(endpoint: string, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  post<T>(endpoint: string, data: any, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  // Error handling, retry logic, etc.
}
```

## Dependencies
None - foundational work

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/ApiClient.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/endpoints.ts` (new)
- `/ui/types/api.ts` (new)
- `/ui/.env.example` (update)

- Code reviewed and approved
- Unit tests passing
- Integration tested with production API
- Documentation complete

summary: Implement JWT Authentication System for Enterprise Portal

content.text:
## Overview
Implement complete authentication and authorization system for the enterprise portal with JWT tokens, role-based access control, and secure session management.

## Business Value
Critical security requirement. Cannot deploy to production without proper authentication. Enables user management and role-based feature access.

## Technical Requirements
1. JWT token authentication flow
2. Login/logout UI components
3. Session management (token storage, refresh)
4. Protected route wrapper component
5. Role-based access control (RBAC)
6. API key management interface
7. User profile management
8. Password reset functionality
9. Remember me functionality
10. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) support

## User Roles
- **Admin**: Full system access
- **Validator**: Node management, consensus participation
- **Observer**: Read-only access
- **Developer**: API testing, performance tools

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Login page with email/password
- [ ] JWT token stored securely (httpOnly cookies preferred)
- [ ] Automatic token refresh before expiry
- [ ] Logout functionality clears session
- [ ] Protected routes redirect to login if unauthenticated
- [ ] RBAC restricts features by role
- [ ] Session timeout after 30 minutes inactivity
- [ ] Remember me extends session to 30 days
- [ ] Password reset via email
- [ ] MFA setup and verification (TOTP)
- [ ] User profile view and edit
- [ ] API key generation and management

## UI Components
- LoginPage
- LogoutButton
- ProtectedRoute wrapper
- UserProfile page
- PasswordReset flow
- MFASetup component
- APIKeyManagement dashboard

## API Integration
Assuming backend provides:
- POST /api/v11/auth/login
- POST /api/v11/auth/logout
- POST /api/v11/auth/refresh
- POST /api/v11/auth/reset-password
- GET/PUT /api/v11/auth/profile
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/setup
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/verify

## Security Requirements
- Passwords never logged or stored in localStorage
- JWT tokens in httpOnly cookies (not localStorage)
- CSRF protection
- Rate limiting on login attempts
- Password strength requirements
- Secure password reset tokens

summary: Setup Global State Management with Redux Toolkit

content.text:
## Overview
Implement centralized state management using Redux Toolkit to manage global application state, API data caching, and real-time updates.

## Business Value
Enables efficient data sharing across components, reduces API calls through caching, and improves application performance.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup Redux Toolkit store
2. Create state slices:
   - auth (user, token, permissions)
   - platform (status, info, metrics)
   - transactions (list, stats, filters)
   - consensus (status, proposals)
   - crypto (status, operations)
   - bridge (stats, transfers)
   - ai (stats, config)
   - hms (stats, assets)
3. Implement selector hooks
4. Add Redux middleware for API calls (RTK Query)
5. Setup state persistence (localStorage)
6. Integrate Redux DevTools
7. Implement optimistic updates

## State Structure
```typescript
interface RootState {
  auth: AuthState
  platform: PlatformState
  transactions: TransactionsState
  consensus: ConsensusState
  crypto: CryptoState
  bridge: BridgeState
  ai: AIState
  hms: HMSState
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Redux Toolkit configured and integrated
- [ ] All state slices created with proper typing
- [ ] Selector hooks for data access
- [ ] RTK Query setup for API caching
- [ ] State persists across page refreshes
- [ ] Redux DevTools working in development
- [ ] No prop drilling in components
- [ ] Efficient re-renders (using selectors)
- [ ] Optimistic updates for mutations
- [ ] Unit tests for reducers and selectors

## Caching Strategy
- Platform metrics: 5-minute cache
- Transaction stats: 10-second cache
- Consensus status: 5-second cache
- User profile: Session cache
- Historical data: 1-hour cache

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/store/index.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/authSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/platformSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/transactionsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/consensusSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/cryptoSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/bridgeSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/aiSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/hmsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppSelector.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppDispatch.ts` (new)
- `/ui/app/layout.tsx` (modify - add Provider)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- All slices implemented and tested
- DevTools integration verified
- Performance benchmarks met
- Documentation complete

## Overview
Build infrastructure for real-time data updates using WebSocket connections with fallback to polling for metrics that require live updates.

## Business Value
Enables real-time monitoring dashboards with sub-second latency for critical metrics like TPS, consensus status, and transaction processing.

## Technical Requirements
1. WebSocket client for real-time metrics
2. Server-Sent Events (SSE) client for streaming
3. Polling service for periodic updates
4. Connection state management
5. Automatic reconnection logic
6. Heartbeat/ping mechanism
7. Data refresh strategies per endpoint type
8. Fallback to polling if WebSocket fails

## Real-Time Endpoints
- Platform status (1s updates)
- Performance metrics (1s updates)
- Transaction stats (5s updates)
- Consensus status (2s updates)
- AI optimization level (10s updates)

## Polling Endpoints
- System info (60s updates)
- Bridge stats (30s updates)
- HMS stats (60s updates)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WebSocket connection established to backend
- [ ] Real-time TPS updates (<1s latency)
- [ ] Connection status indicator in UI
- [ ] Automatic reconnection on disconnect
- [ ] Fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable
- [ ] Configurable refresh intervals per metric
- [ ] Data staleness indicators
- [ ] Pause/resume real-time updates (when tab inactive)
- [ ] Memory leak prevention (cleanup on unmount)
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures

## Connection State
```typescript
type ConnectionState = 'connected' | 'connecting' | 'disconnected' | 'error'
```

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-003 (Global State Management)
- Backend WebSocket support (may need implementation)

content.text:
Create a comprehensive demo application showcasing Aurigraph DLT's scalability with configurable nodes (Channel, Validator, Business, API Integration), real-time Vizro visualization, and genuine external data integration from Alpaca and W.com feeds.

Key Features:
 Configurable node types with real-time panel visualization
 Live consensus participation tracking
 Transaction processing visualization
 Data submission monitoring

 Real-time Vizro graph showing:
  - Throughput (TPS)
  - Consensus performance
  - Data feed rates
 Genuine data integration testing with:
  - Alpaca API (market data)
  - W.com feed (weather data)

Success Criteria:
 Real-time node visualization
 Scalability demonstration (1M+ TPS)
 Live API data integration
 Interactive node configuration
 Production-ready demo

Technology Stack:
 Frontend: HTML5, JavaScript, Vizro/D3.js
 Backend: Aurigraph V11 (Java/Quarkus)
 APIs: Alpaca, W.com (OpenWeatherMap)
 WebSocket: Real-time updates

summary: Design Node Architecture and Configuration System

content.text:
*Objective:* Design the architecture for configurable node types and their interaction patterns.

*Node Types:*
1. *Channel Nodes* - Message routing and communication
2. *Validator Nodes* - Consensus participation and block validation
3. *Business Nodes* - Transaction processing and business logic
4. *API Integration Nodes* - External data ingestion (Alpaca, W.com)

*Tasks:*
 Define node state models (idle, active, processing, consensus)
 Design node configuration schema (JSON)
 Create node lifecycle management
 Define inter-node communication protocol
 Design node panel UI/UX mockups

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 Architecture document complete
 Node configuration schema defined
 UI mockups approved
 Communication protocol specified

*Objective:* Implement Channel Nodes for message routing and network communication.

*Features:*
 Message queue management
 Routing logic
 Load balancing across validators
 Real-time status updates
 Panel visualization (active connections, message rate)

*Technical Details:*
 WebSocket connections for real-time updates
 Message throughput tracking
 Connection pool management
 Status indicators (connected, routing, overload)

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 Channel nodes route messages correctly
 Real-time panel shows message flow
 Load balancing works across nodes
 Status updates in <100ms

summary: Implement Validator Node System with Consensus Visualization

summary: Build API Client Service Layer for V11 Integration

content.text:
## Overview
Create a centralized API client service layer to handle all HTTP communications with the V11 backend API at dlt.aurigraph.io:9003.

## Business Value
Blocks all production functionality. Without this foundational service, no UI component can communicate with the backend.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup HTTP client using axios with TypeScript
2. Configure base URL from environment variables
3. Implement request/response interceptors
4. Add global error handling middleware
5. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
6. Configure request timeout (30s default)
7. Add request/response logging for debugging
8. Create TypeScript interfaces for all API responses

## API Endpoints to Support
- Base URL: http://dlt.aurigraph.io:9003/api/v11
- All 17 V11 endpoints

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Axios client configured with interceptors
- [ ] Environment-based URL configuration (.env files)
- [ ] Global error handling catches all API errors
- [ ] Request retry on network failures (3 retries max)
- [ ] TypeScript types for all API responses
- [ ] Request/response logging in development mode
- [ ] Unit tests for client service (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Documentation with usage examples

## Technical Details
```typescript
// Example structure
class ApiClient {
  constructor(baseURL: string)
  get<T>(endpoint: string, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  post<T>(endpoint: string, data: any, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  // Error handling, retry logic, etc.
}
```

## Dependencies
None - foundational work

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/ApiClient.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/endpoints.ts` (new)
- `/ui/types/api.ts` (new)
- `/ui/.env.example` (update)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Unit tests passing
- Integration tested with production API
- Documentation complete

summary: Implement JWT Authentication System for Enterprise Portal

content.text:
## Overview
Implement complete authentication and authorization system for the enterprise portal with JWT tokens, role-based access control, and secure session management.

## Business Value
Critical security requirement. Cannot deploy to production without proper authentication. Enables user management and role-based feature access.

## Technical Requirements
1. JWT token authentication flow
2. Login/logout UI components
3. Session management (token storage, refresh)
4. Protected route wrapper component
5. Role-based access control (RBAC)
6. API key management interface
7. User profile management
8. Password reset functionality
9. Remember me functionality
10. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) support

## User Roles
- **Admin**: Full system access
- **Validator**: Node management, consensus participation
- **Observer**: Read-only access
- **Developer**: API testing, performance tools

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Login page with email/password
- [ ] JWT token stored securely (httpOnly cookies preferred)
- [ ] Automatic token refresh before expiry
- [ ] Logout functionality clears session
- [ ] Protected routes redirect to login if unauthenticated
- [ ] RBAC restricts features by role
- [ ] Session timeout after 30 minutes inactivity
- [ ] Remember me extends session to 30 days
- [ ] Password reset via email
- [ ] MFA setup and verification (TOTP)
- [ ] User profile view and edit
- [ ] API key generation and management

## UI Components
- LoginPage
- LogoutButton
- ProtectedRoute wrapper
- UserProfile page
- PasswordReset flow
- MFASetup component
- APIKeyManagement dashboard

## API Integration
Assuming backend provides:
- POST /api/v11/auth/login
- POST /api/v11/auth/logout
- POST /api/v11/auth/refresh
- POST /api/v11/auth/reset-password
- GET/PUT /api/v11/auth/profile
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/setup
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/verify

## Security Requirements
- Passwords never logged or stored in localStorage
- JWT tokens in httpOnly cookies (not localStorage)
- CSRF protection
- Rate limiting on login attempts
- Password strength requirements
- Secure password reset tokens

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/pages/auth/login.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/reset-password.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/profile.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/components/auth/ProtectedRoute.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/contexts/AuthContext.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAuth.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/authService.ts` (new)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Security audit passed
- Unit and integration tests passing
- Documentation complete
- User acceptance testing passed

summary: Setup Global State Management with Redux Toolkit

content.text:
## Overview
Implement centralized state management using Redux Toolkit to manage global application state, API data caching, and real-time updates.

## Business Value
Enables efficient data sharing across components, reduces API calls through caching, and improves application performance.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup Redux Toolkit store
2. Create state slices:
   - auth (user, token, permissions)
   - platform (status, info, metrics)
   - transactions (list, stats, filters)
   - consensus (status, proposals)
   - crypto (status, operations)
   - bridge (stats, transfers)
   - ai (stats, config)
   - hms (stats, assets)
3. Implement selector hooks
4. Add Redux middleware for API calls (RTK Query)
5. Setup state persistence (localStorage)
6. Integrate Redux DevTools
7. Implement optimistic updates

## State Structure
```typescript
interface RootState {
  auth: AuthState
  platform: PlatformState
  transactions: TransactionsState
  consensus: ConsensusState
  crypto: CryptoState
  bridge: BridgeState
  ai: AIState
  hms: HMSState
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Redux Toolkit configured and integrated
- [ ] All state slices created with proper typing
- [ ] Selector hooks for data access
- [ ] RTK Query setup for API caching
- [ ] State persists across page refreshes
- [ ] Redux DevTools working in development
- [ ] No prop drilling in components
- [ ] Efficient re-renders (using selectors)
- [ ] Optimistic updates for mutations
- [ ] Unit tests for reducers and selectors

## Caching Strategy
- Platform metrics: 5-minute cache
- Transaction stats: 10-second cache
- Consensus status: 5-second cache
- User profile: Session cache
- Historical data: 1-hour cache

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/store/index.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/authSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/platformSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/transactionsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/consensusSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/cryptoSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/bridgeSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/aiSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/hmsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppSelector.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppDispatch.ts` (new)
- `/ui/app/layout.tsx` (modify - add Provider)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- All slices implemented and tested
- DevTools integration verified
- Performance benchmarks met
- Documentation complete

## Overview
Build infrastructure for real-time data updates using WebSocket connections with fallback to polling for metrics that require live updates.

## Business Value
Enables real-time monitoring dashboards with sub-second latency for critical metrics like TPS, consensus status, and transaction processing.

## Technical Requirements
1. WebSocket client for real-time metrics
2. Server-Sent Events (SSE) client for streaming
3. Polling service for periodic updates
4. Connection state management
5. Automatic reconnection logic
6. Heartbeat/ping mechanism
7. Data refresh strategies per endpoint type
8. Fallback to polling if WebSocket fails

## Real-Time Endpoints
- Platform status (1s updates)
- Performance metrics (1s updates)
- Transaction stats (5s updates)
- Consensus status (2s updates)
- AI optimization level (10s updates)

## Polling Endpoints
- System info (60s updates)
- Bridge stats (30s updates)
- HMS stats (60s updates)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WebSocket connection established to backend
- [ ] Real-time TPS updates (<1s latency)
- [ ] Connection status indicator in UI
- [ ] Automatic reconnection on disconnect
- [ ] Fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable
- [ ] Configurable refresh intervals per metric
- [ ] Data staleness indicators
- [ ] Pause/resume real-time updates (when tab inactive)
- [ ] Memory leak prevention (cleanup on unmount)
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures

## Connection State
```typescript
type ConnectionState = 'connected' | 'connecting' | 'disconnected' | 'error'
```

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-003 (Global State Management)
- Backend WebSocket support (may need implementation)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/websocketService.ts` (new)

- `/ui/hooks/useRealTimeData.ts` (new)
- `/ui/components/ConnectionStatus.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/connectionSlice.ts` (new)

## Definition of Done

- Unit and integration tests passing
- Connection stability tested
- Memory leak tests passed
- Documentation complete

summary: Integrate Dashboard with Production API Endpoints

content.text:
## Overview
Replace all mock data in the main dashboard with real API integrations for platform status, performance metrics, transactions, consensus, crypto, bridge, and AI statistics.

## Business Value
Transforms dashboard from prototype to production-ready monitoring tool with real-time data from the V11 platform.

## API Endpoints to Integrate
1. GET /api/v11/status - Platform health and uptime
2. GET /api/v11/info - System information
3. GET /api/v11/transactions/stats - Transaction statistics
4. GET /api/v11/performance/metrics - Performance metrics
5. GET /api/v11/consensus/status - Consensus status
6. GET /api/v11/crypto/status - Quantum crypto status
7. GET /api/v11/bridge/stats - Bridge statistics
8. GET /api/v11/ai/stats - AI optimization statistics

## Current Mock Data to Replace
- TPS counter (950K-1.1M random)
- Latency (200-500ms random)
- Active validators (21 static)
- Security level (Level 5 static)
- Cross-chain metrics (random)
- AI optimization level (90-100% random)

## Technical Requirements
1. Remove all `Math.random()` mock data generation
2. Implement data fetching with useEffect/Redux
3. Add loading states for each metric card
4. Add error states with retry buttons
5. Implement real-time updates (via GAP-004)
6. Add data caching (5-minute TTL)
7. Add manual refresh button
8. Add last updated timestamp
9. Optimize API call patterns (batch where possible)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All metrics display real API data
- [ ] Loading spinners during data fetch
- [ ] Error messages with retry option
- [ ] Real-time updates for live metrics
- [ ] Data cached appropriately
- [ ] Manual refresh works
- [ ] Last updated timestamp displayed

summary: Design Node Architecture and Configuration System

content.text:
*Objective:* Design the architecture for configurable node types and their interaction patterns.

*Node Types:*
1. *Channel Nodes* - Message routing and communication
2. *Validator Nodes* - Consensus participation and block validation
3. *Business Nodes* - Transaction processing and business logic
4. *API Integration Nodes* - External data ingestion (Alpaca, W.com)

*Tasks:*
 Define node state models (idle, active, processing, consensus)
 Design node configuration schema (JSON)
 Create node lifecycle management
 Define inter-node communication protocol
 Design node panel UI/UX mockups

 Architecture document complete
 Node configuration schema defined
 UI mockups approved
 Communication protocol specified

summary: AI/ML Infrastructure Implementation - Neural Network Consensus Optimization

content.text:
COMPLETED: AI/ML Infrastructure Implementation

Implementation Details:

1. AIConsensusOptimizer
- Created neural network-based consensus optimization
- Implements prediction models for consensus efficiency
- Target: 20-30% throughput improvement

2. PredictiveTransactionOrdering 
- ML-based transaction optimization
- Reduces consensus rounds through intelligent ordering
- Improves overall system efficiency

3. AnomalyDetectionService
- Real-time anomaly detection system
- Monitors throughput degradation and latency spikes
- Automatic system health monitoring

4. AdaptiveBatchProcessor
- Dynamic batch size optimization based on network conditions
- ML-driven performance tuning
- Reduces latency through intelligent batching

5. AIOptimizationService
- Main ML coordinator service
- Orchestrates all AI optimization components
- Provides centralized ML management

Technical Implementation:

summary: Build API Client Service Layer for V11 Integration

content.text:
## Overview
Create a centralized API client service layer to handle all HTTP communications with the V11 backend API at dlt.aurigraph.io:9003.

## Business Value
Blocks all production functionality. Without this foundational service, no UI component can communicate with the backend.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup HTTP client using axios with TypeScript
2. Configure base URL from environment variables
3. Implement request/response interceptors
4. Add global error handling middleware
5. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
6. Configure request timeout (30s default)
7. Add request/response logging for debugging
8. Create TypeScript interfaces for all API responses

## API Endpoints to Support
- Base URL: http://dlt.aurigraph.io:9003/api/v11
- All 17 V11 endpoints

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Axios client configured with interceptors
- [ ] Environment-based URL configuration (.env files)
- [ ] Global error handling catches all API errors
- [ ] Request retry on network failures (3 retries max)
- [ ] TypeScript types for all API responses
- [ ] Request/response logging in development mode
- [ ] Unit tests for client service (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Documentation with usage examples

## Technical Details
```typescript
// Example structure
class ApiClient {
  constructor(baseURL: string)
  get<T>(endpoint: string, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  post<T>(endpoint: string, data: any, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  // Error handling, retry logic, etc.
}
```

## Dependencies
None - foundational work

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/ApiClient.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/endpoints.ts` (new)
- `/ui/types/api.ts` (new)
- `/ui/.env.example` (update)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Unit tests passing
- Integration tested with production API
- Documentation complete

summary: Implement JWT Authentication System for Enterprise Portal

content.text:
## Overview
Implement complete authentication and authorization system for the enterprise portal with JWT tokens, role-based access control, and secure session management.

## Business Value
Critical security requirement. Cannot deploy to production without proper authentication. Enables user management and role-based feature access.

## Technical Requirements
1. JWT token authentication flow
2. Login/logout UI components
3. Session management (token storage, refresh)
4. Protected route wrapper component
5. Role-based access control (RBAC)
6. API key management interface
7. User profile management
8. Password reset functionality
9. Remember me functionality
10. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) support

## User Roles
- **Admin**: Full system access
- **Validator**: Node management, consensus participation
- **Observer**: Read-only access
- **Developer**: API testing, performance tools

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Login page with email/password
- [ ] JWT token stored securely (httpOnly cookies preferred)
- [ ] Automatic token refresh before expiry
- [ ] Logout functionality clears session
- [ ] Protected routes redirect to login if unauthenticated
- [ ] RBAC restricts features by role
- [ ] Session timeout after 30 minutes inactivity
- [ ] Remember me extends session to 30 days
- [ ] Password reset via email
- [ ] MFA setup and verification (TOTP)
- [ ] User profile view and edit
- [ ] API key generation and management

## UI Components
- LoginPage
- LogoutButton
- ProtectedRoute wrapper
- UserProfile page
- PasswordReset flow
- MFASetup component
- APIKeyManagement dashboard

## API Integration
Assuming backend provides:
- POST /api/v11/auth/login
- POST /api/v11/auth/logout
- POST /api/v11/auth/refresh
- POST /api/v11/auth/reset-password
- GET/PUT /api/v11/auth/profile
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/setup
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/verify

## Security Requirements
- Passwords never logged or stored in localStorage
- JWT tokens in httpOnly cookies (not localStorage)
- CSRF protection
- Rate limiting on login attempts
- Password strength requirements
- Secure password reset tokens

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/pages/auth/login.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/reset-password.tsx` (new)

- `/ui/services/authService.ts` (new)

- Security audit passed
- Unit and integration tests passing
- Documentation complete
- User acceptance testing passed

summary: Setup Global State Management with Redux Toolkit

content.text:
## Overview
Implement centralized state management using Redux Toolkit to manage global application state, API data caching, and real-time updates.

## Business Value
Enables efficient data sharing across components, reduces API calls through caching, and improves application performance.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup Redux Toolkit store
2. Create state slices:
   - auth (user, token, permissions)
   - platform (status, info, metrics)
   - transactions (list, stats, filters)
   - consensus (status, proposals)
   - crypto (status, operations)
   - bridge (stats, transfers)
   - ai (stats, config)
   - hms (stats, assets)
3. Implement selector hooks
4. Add Redux middleware for API calls (RTK Query)
5. Setup state persistence (localStorage)
6. Integrate Redux DevTools
7. Implement optimistic updates

## State Structure
```typescript
interface RootState {
  auth: AuthState
  platform: PlatformState
  transactions: TransactionsState
  consensus: ConsensusState
  crypto: CryptoState
  bridge: BridgeState
  ai: AIState
  hms: HMSState
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Redux Toolkit configured and integrated
- [ ] All state slices created with proper typing
- [ ] Selector hooks for data access
- [ ] RTK Query setup for API caching
- [ ] State persists across page refreshes
- [ ] Redux DevTools working in development
- [ ] No prop drilling in components
- [ ] Efficient re-renders (using selectors)
- [ ] Optimistic updates for mutations
- [ ] Unit tests for reducers and selectors

## Caching Strategy
- Platform metrics: 5-minute cache
- Transaction stats: 10-second cache
- Consensus status: 5-second cache
- User profile: Session cache
- Historical data: 1-hour cache

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/store/index.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/authSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/platformSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/transactionsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/consensusSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/cryptoSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/bridgeSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/aiSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/hmsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppSelector.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppDispatch.ts` (new)
- `/ui/app/layout.tsx` (modify - add Provider)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- All slices implemented and tested
- DevTools integration verified
- Performance benchmarks met
- Documentation complete

## Overview
Build infrastructure for real-time data updates using WebSocket connections with fallback to polling for metrics that require live updates.

## Business Value
Enables real-time monitoring dashboards with sub-second latency for critical metrics like TPS, consensus status, and transaction processing.

## Technical Requirements
1. WebSocket client for real-time metrics
2. Server-Sent Events (SSE) client for streaming
3. Polling service for periodic updates
4. Connection state management
5. Automatic reconnection logic
6. Heartbeat/ping mechanism
7. Data refresh strategies per endpoint type
8. Fallback to polling if WebSocket fails

## Real-Time Endpoints
- Platform status (1s updates)
- Performance metrics (1s updates)
- Transaction stats (5s updates)
- Consensus status (2s updates)
- AI optimization level (10s updates)

## Polling Endpoints
- System info (60s updates)
- Bridge stats (30s updates)
- HMS stats (60s updates)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WebSocket connection established to backend
- [ ] Real-time TPS updates (<1s latency)
- [ ] Connection status indicator in UI
- [ ] Automatic reconnection on disconnect
- [ ] Fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable
- [ ] Configurable refresh intervals per metric
- [ ] Data staleness indicators
- [ ] Pause/resume real-time updates (when tab inactive)
- [ ] Memory leak prevention (cleanup on unmount)
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures

## Connection State
```typescript
type ConnectionState = 'connected' | 'connecting' | 'disconnected' | 'error'
```

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-003 (Global State Management)
- Backend WebSocket support (may need implementation)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/websocketService.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/pollingService.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useRealTimeData.ts` (new)
- `/ui/components/ConnectionStatus.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/connectionSlice.ts` (new)

## Definition of Done

- Unit and integration tests passing
- Connection stability tested
- Memory leak tests passed
- Documentation complete

summary: Build API Client Service Layer for V11 Integration

content.text:
## Overview
Create a centralized API client service layer to handle all HTTP communications with the V11 backend API at dlt.aurigraph.io:9003.

## Business Value
Blocks all production functionality. Without this foundational service, no UI component can communicate with the backend.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup HTTP client using axios with TypeScript
2. Configure base URL from environment variables
3. Implement request/response interceptors
4. Add global error handling middleware
5. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
6. Configure request timeout (30s default)
7. Add request/response logging for debugging
8. Create TypeScript interfaces for all API responses

## API Endpoints to Support
- Base URL: http://dlt.aurigraph.io:9003/api/v11
- All 17 V11 endpoints

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Axios client configured with interceptors

}

summary: Implement JWT Authentication System for Enterprise Portal

content.text:
## Overview
Implement complete authentication and authorization system for the enterprise portal with JWT tokens, role-based access control, and secure session management.

## Business Value
Critical security requirement. Cannot deploy to production without proper authentication. Enables user management and role-based feature access.

## Technical Requirements
1. JWT token authentication flow
2. Login/logout UI components
3. Session management (token storage, refresh)
4. Protected route wrapper component
5. Role-based access control (RBAC)
6. API key management interface
7. User profile management
8. Password reset functionality
9. Remember me functionality
10. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) support

## User Roles
- **Admin**: Full system access
- **Validator**: Node management, consensus participation
- **Observer**: Read-only access
- **Developer**: API testing, performance tools

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Login page with email/password
- [ ] JWT token stored securely (httpOnly cookies preferred)
- [ ] Automatic token refresh before expiry
- [ ] Logout functionality clears session
- [ ] Protected routes redirect to login if unauthenticated
- [ ] RBAC restricts features by role
- [ ] Session timeout after 30 minutes inactivity
- [ ] Remember me extends session to 30 days
- [ ] Password reset via email
- [ ] MFA setup and verification (TOTP)
- [ ] User profile view and edit
- [ ] API key generation and management

## UI Components
- LoginPage
- LogoutButton
- ProtectedRoute wrapper
- UserProfile page
- PasswordReset flow
- MFASetup component
- APIKeyManagement dashboard

## API Integration
Assuming backend provides:
- POST /api/v11/auth/login
- POST /api/v11/auth/logout
- POST /api/v11/auth/refresh
- POST /api/v11/auth/reset-password
- GET/PUT /api/v11/auth/profile
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/setup
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/verify

## Security Requirements
- Passwords never logged or stored in localStorage
- JWT tokens in httpOnly cookies (not localStorage)
- CSRF protection
- Rate limiting on login attempts
- Password strength requirements
- Secure password reset tokens

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/pages/auth/login.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/reset-password.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/pages/auth/profile.tsx` (new)

- `/ui/hooks/useAuth.ts` (new)

- Documentation complete

summary: Setup Global State Management with Redux Toolkit

content.text:
## Overview
Implement centralized state management using Redux Toolkit to manage global application state, API data caching, and real-time updates.

## Business Value
Enables efficient data sharing across components, reduces API calls through caching, and improves application performance.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup Redux Toolkit store
2. Create state slices:
   - auth (user, token, permissions)
   - platform (status, info, metrics)
   - transactions (list, stats, filters)
   - consensus (status, proposals)
   - crypto (status, operations)
   - bridge (stats, transfers)
   - ai (stats, config)
   - hms (stats, assets)
3. Implement selector hooks
4. Add Redux middleware for API calls (RTK Query)
5. Setup state persistence (localStorage)
6. Integrate Redux DevTools
7. Implement optimistic updates

## State Structure
```typescript
interface RootState {
  auth: AuthState
  platform: PlatformState
  transactions: TransactionsState
  consensus: ConsensusState
  crypto: CryptoState
  bridge: BridgeState
  ai: AIState
  hms: HMSState
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Redux Toolkit configured and integrated
- [ ] All state slices created with proper typing
- [ ] Selector hooks for data access
- [ ] RTK Query setup for API caching
- [ ] State persists across page refreshes
- [ ] Redux DevTools working in development
- [ ] No prop drilling in components
- [ ] Efficient re-renders (using selectors)
- [ ] Optimistic updates for mutations
- [ ] Unit tests for reducers and selectors

## Caching Strategy
- Platform metrics: 5-minute cache
- Transaction stats: 10-second cache
- Consensus status: 5-second cache
- User profile: Session cache
- Historical data: 1-hour cache

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/store/index.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/authSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/platformSlice.ts` (new)

- `/ui/store/slices/consensusSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/cryptoSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/bridgeSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/aiSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/hmsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppSelector.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppDispatch.ts` (new)
- `/ui/app/layout.tsx` (modify - add Provider)

## Definition of Done

- All slices implemented and tested
- DevTools integration verified
- Performance benchmarks met
- Documentation complete

## Overview
Build infrastructure for real-time data updates using WebSocket connections with fallback to polling for metrics that require live updates.

## Business Value
Enables real-time monitoring dashboards with sub-second latency for critical metrics like TPS, consensus status, and transaction processing.

## Technical Requirements
1. WebSocket client for real-time metrics
2. Server-Sent Events (SSE) client for streaming
3. Polling service for periodic updates
4. Connection state management
5. Automatic reconnection logic
6. Heartbeat/ping mechanism
7. Data refresh strategies per endpoint type
8. Fallback to polling if WebSocket fails

## Real-Time Endpoints
- Platform status (1s updates)
- Performance metrics (1s updates)
- Transaction stats (5s updates)
- Consensus status (2s updates)
- AI optimization level (10s updates)

## Polling Endpoints
- System info (60s updates)
- Bridge stats (30s updates)
- HMS stats (60s updates)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WebSocket connection established to backend
- [ ] Real-time TPS updates (<1s latency)
- [ ] Connection status indicator in UI
- [ ] Automatic reconnection on disconnect
- [ ] Fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable
- [ ] Configurable refresh intervals per metric
- [ ] Data staleness indicators
- [ ] Pause/resume real-time updates (when tab inactive)
- [ ] Memory leak prevention (cleanup on unmount)
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures

## Connection State
```typescript
type ConnectionState = 'connected' | 'connecting' | 'disconnected' | 'error'
```

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-003 (Global State Management)
- Backend WebSocket support (may need implementation)

summary: Build API Client Service Layer for V11 Integration

content.text:
## Overview
Create a centralized API client service layer to handle all HTTP communications with the V11 backend API at dlt.aurigraph.io:9003.

## Business Value
Blocks all production functionality. Without this foundational service, no UI component can communicate with the backend.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup HTTP client using axios with TypeScript
2. Configure base URL from environment variables
3. Implement request/response interceptors
4. Add global error handling middleware
5. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
6. Configure request timeout (30s default)
7. Add request/response logging for debugging
8. Create TypeScript interfaces for all API responses

## API Endpoints to Support
- Base URL: http://dlt.aurigraph.io:9003/api/v11
- All 17 V11 endpoints

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Axios client configured with interceptors
- [ ] Environment-based URL configuration (.env files)
- [ ] Global error handling catches all API errors
- [ ] Request retry on network failures (3 retries max)
- [ ] TypeScript types for all API responses
- [ ] Request/response logging in development mode
- [ ] Unit tests for client service (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Documentation with usage examples

## Technical Details
```typescript
// Example structure
class ApiClient {
  constructor(baseURL: string)
  get<T>(endpoint: string, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  post<T>(endpoint: string, data: any, config?: AxiosConfig): Promise<T>
  // Error handling, retry logic, etc.
}
```

## Dependencies
None - foundational work

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/services/ApiClient.ts` (new)
- `/ui/services/endpoints.ts` (new)
- `/ui/types/api.ts` (new)
- `/ui/.env.example` (update)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- Unit tests passing
- Integration tested with production API
- Documentation complete

summary: Implement JWT Authentication System for Enterprise Portal

content.text:
## Overview
Implement complete authentication and authorization system for the enterprise portal with JWT tokens, role-based access control, and secure session management.

## Business Value
Critical security requirement. Cannot deploy to production without proper authentication. Enables user management and role-based feature access.

## Technical Requirements
1. JWT token authentication flow
2. Login/logout UI components
3. Session management (token storage, refresh)
4. Protected route wrapper component
5. Role-based access control (RBAC)
6. API key management interface
7. User profile management
8. Password reset functionality
9. Remember me functionality
10. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) support

## User Roles
- **Admin**: Full system access
- **Validator**: Node management, consensus participation
- **Observer**: Read-only access
- **Developer**: API testing, performance tools

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Login page with email/password
- [ ] JWT token stored securely (httpOnly cookies preferred)
- [ ] Automatic token refresh before expiry
- [ ] Logout functionality clears session
- [ ] Protected routes redirect to login if unauthenticated
- [ ] RBAC restricts features by role
- [ ] Session timeout after 30 minutes inactivity
- [ ] Remember me extends session to 30 days
- [ ] Password reset via email
- [ ] MFA setup and verification (TOTP)
- [ ] User profile view and edit
- [ ] API key generation and management

## UI Components
- LoginPage
- LogoutButton
- ProtectedRoute wrapper
- UserProfile page
- PasswordReset flow
- MFASetup component
- APIKeyManagement dashboard

## API Integration
Assuming backend provides:
- POST /api/v11/auth/login
- POST /api/v11/auth/logout
- POST /api/v11/auth/refresh
- POST /api/v11/auth/reset-password
- GET/PUT /api/v11/auth/profile
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/setup
- POST /api/v11/auth/mfa/verify

## Security Requirements
- Passwords never logged or stored in localStorage
- JWT tokens in httpOnly cookies (not localStorage)
- CSRF protection
- Rate limiting on login attempts
- Password strength requirements
- Secure password reset tokens

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

- Documentation complete

summary: Setup Global State Management with Redux Toolkit

content.text:
## Overview
Implement centralized state management using Redux Toolkit to manage global application state, API data caching, and real-time updates.

## Business Value
Enables efficient data sharing across components, reduces API calls through caching, and improves application performance.

## Technical Requirements
1. Setup Redux Toolkit store
2. Create state slices:
   - auth (user, token, permissions)
   - platform (status, info, metrics)
   - transactions (list, stats, filters)
   - consensus (status, proposals)
   - crypto (status, operations)
   - bridge (stats, transfers)
   - ai (stats, config)
   - hms (stats, assets)
3. Implement selector hooks
4. Add Redux middleware for API calls (RTK Query)
5. Setup state persistence (localStorage)
6. Integrate Redux DevTools
7. Implement optimistic updates

## State Structure
```typescript
interface RootState {
  auth: AuthState
  platform: PlatformState
  transactions: TransactionsState
  consensus: ConsensusState
  crypto: CryptoState
  bridge: BridgeState
  ai: AIState
  hms: HMSState
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Redux Toolkit configured and integrated
- [ ] All state slices created with proper typing
- [ ] Selector hooks for data access
- [ ] RTK Query setup for API caching
- [ ] State persists across page refreshes
- [ ] Redux DevTools working in development
- [ ] No prop drilling in components
- [ ] Efficient re-renders (using selectors)
- [ ] Optimistic updates for mutations
- [ ] Unit tests for reducers and selectors

## Caching Strategy
- Platform metrics: 5-minute cache
- Transaction stats: 10-second cache
- Consensus status: 5-second cache
- User profile: Session cache
- Historical data: 1-hour cache

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)

## Files to Create/Modify
- `/ui/store/index.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/authSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/platformSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/transactionsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/consensusSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/cryptoSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/bridgeSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/aiSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/store/slices/hmsSlice.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppSelector.ts` (new)
- `/ui/hooks/useAppDispatch.ts` (new)
- `/ui/app/layout.tsx` (modify - add Provider)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- All slices implemented and tested
- DevTools integration verified
- Performance benchmarks met
- Documentation complete

## Overview
Build infrastructure for real-time data updates using WebSocket connections with fallback to polling for metrics that require live updates.

## Business Value
Enables real-time monitoring dashboards with sub-second latency for critical metrics like TPS, consensus status, and transaction processing.

## Technical Requirements
1. WebSocket client for real-time metrics
2. Server-Sent Events (SSE) client for streaming
3. Polling service for periodic updates
4. Connection state management
5. Automatic reconnection logic
6. Heartbeat/ping mechanism
7. Data refresh strategies per endpoint type
8. Fallback to polling if WebSocket fails

## Real-Time Endpoints
- Platform status (1s updates)
- Performance metrics (1s updates)
- Transaction stats (5s updates)
- Consensus status (2s updates)
- AI optimization level (10s updates)

## Polling Endpoints
- System info (60s updates)
- Bridge stats (30s updates)
- HMS stats (60s updates)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WebSocket connection established to backend
- [ ] Real-time TPS updates (<1s latency)
- [ ] Connection status indicator in UI
- [ ] Automatic reconnection on disconnect
- [ ] Fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable
- [ ] Configurable refresh intervals per metric
- [ ] Data staleness indicators
- [ ] Pause/resume real-time updates (when tab inactive)
- [ ] Memory leak prevention (cleanup on unmount)
- [ ] Error handling for connection failures

## Connection State
```typescript
type ConnectionState = 'connected' | 'connecting' | 'disconnected' | 'error'
```

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-003 (Global State Management)
- Backend WebSocket support (may need implementation)

summary: Integrate Dashboard with Production API Endpoints

content.text:
## Overview
Replace all mock data in the main dashboard with real API integrations for platform status, performance metrics, transactions, consensus, crypto, bridge, and AI statistics.

## Business Value
Transforms dashboard from prototype to production-ready monitoring tool with real-time data from the V11 platform.

## API Endpoints to Integrate
1. GET /api/v11/status - Platform health and uptime
2. GET /api/v11/info - System information
3. GET /api/v11/transactions/stats - Transaction statistics
4. GET /api/v11/performance/metrics - Performance metrics
5. GET /api/v11/consensus/status - Consensus status
6. GET /api/v11/crypto/status - Quantum crypto status
7. GET /api/v11/bridge/stats - Bridge statistics
8. GET /api/v11/ai/stats - AI optimization statistics

## Current Mock Data to Replace
- TPS counter (950K-1.1M random)
- Latency (200-500ms random)
- Active validators (21 static)
- Security level (Level 5 static)
- Cross-chain metrics (random)
- AI optimization level (90-100% random)

## Technical Requirements
1. Remove all `Math.random()` mock data generation
2. Implement data fetching with useEffect/Redux
3. Add loading states for each metric card
4. Add error states with retry buttons
5. Implement real-time updates (via GAP-004)
6. Add data caching (5-minute TTL)
7. Add manual refresh button
8. Add last updated timestamp
9. Optimize API call patterns (batch where possible)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All metrics display real API data
- [ ] Loading spinners during data fetch
- [ ] Error messages with retry option
- [ ] Real-time updates for live metrics
- [ ] Data cached appropriately
- [ ] Manual refresh works
- [ ] Last updated timestamp displayed
- [ ] No console errors
- [ ] Performance: page loads in <2s
- [ ] Graceful degradation if API unavailable

## UI Components to Update
- `/ui/app/page.tsx` - Main dashboard
- `/ui/components/MetricCard.tsx` - Add loading/error states
- `/ui/components/PerformanceChart.tsx` - Real data source

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-003 (Global State Management)
- GAP-004 (Real-Time Data Infrastructure)

## Definition of Done
- Code reviewed and approved
- All mock data removed
- Integration tests passing
- Performance benchmarks met
- User acceptance testing passed
- Documentation updated

## Overview
Create interface for uploading and processing batch transactions via CSV/JSON files using POST /api/v11/transactions/batch.

## Business Value
Enables enterprise bulk operations and high-volume transaction processing.

## API Endpoint
- POST /api/v11/transactions/batch

## Technical Requirements
1. File upload interface (CSV/JSON)
2. File validation and preview
3. Batch processing with progress tracking
4. Success/failure summary
5. Failed transaction report
6. Batch history with filters
7. Template download
8. Retry failed transactions

## UI Components
1. **Upload Panel**
   - Drag-and-drop file upload
   - File format selector (CSV/JSON)
   - File size limit (10MB)
   - Template download button

2. **Validation Panel**
   - Preview first 10 transactions
   - Validation errors display
   - Total transaction count
   - Estimated processing time

3. **Processing Panel**
   - Progress bar
   - TPS during processing
   - Success/failure counters
   - Cancel button

4. **Results Panel**
   - Total processed
   - Success count
   - Failure count
   - Failed transaction details
   - Export failed transactions
   - Retry failed button

## File Formats
**CSV:**
```
transactionId,amount
tx_001,100.50
tx_002,200.75
```

**JSON:**
```json
{
  "transactions": [
    {"transactionId": "tx_001", "amount": 100.50},
    {"transactionId": "tx_002", "amount": 200.75}
  ]
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Upload CSV/JSON files
- [ ] Validate file format and content
- [ ] Preview transactions before submission
- [ ] Process batch with progress tracking
- [ ] Display success/failure summary
- [ ] Export failed transactions
- [ ] Retry failed transactions
- [ ] Download CSV/JSON templates
- [ ] Batch size limits enforced (max 10,000)
- [ ] Error handling with user messages

## Dependencies
- GAP-001 (API Client Service Layer)
- GAP-002 (Authentication System)

## Files to Create
- `/ui/app/transactions/batch/page.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/components/batch/FileUpload.tsx` (new)
- `/ui/components/batch/BatchPreview.tsx` (new)

- `/ui/components/batch/BatchResults.tsx` (new)

- User acceptance testing passed
- Documentation complete

summary: Real-Time Scalable Node Visualization Demo Application

content.text:
Create a comprehensive demo application showcasing Aurigraph DLT's scalability with configurable nodes (Channel, Validator, Business, API Integration), real-time Vizro visualization, and genuine external data integration from Alpaca and W.com feeds.

Key Features:
 Configurable node types with real-time panel visualization
 Live consensus participation tracking
 Transaction processing visualization
 Data submission monitoring
 API integration nodes with on/off toggle
 Real-time Vizro graph showing:
  - Throughput (TPS)
  - Consensus performance
  - Data feed rates
 Genuine data integration testing with:
  - Alpaca API (market data)
  - W.com feed (weather data)

Success Criteria:
 Real-time node visualization
 Scalability demonstration (1M+ TPS)
 Live API data integration
 Interactive node configuration
 Production-ready demo

Technology Stack:
 Frontend: HTML5, JavaScript, Vizro/D3.js
 Backend: Aurigraph V11 (Java/Quarkus)
 APIs: Alpaca, W.com (OpenWeatherMap)
 WebSocket: Real-time updates

summary: Design Node Architecture and Configuration System

content.text:
*Objective:* Design the architecture for configurable node types and their interaction patterns.

*Node Types:*
1. *Channel Nodes* - Message routing and communication
2. *Validator Nodes* - Consensus participation and block validation
3. *Business Nodes* - Transaction processing and business logic
4. *API Integration Nodes* - External data ingestion (Alpaca, W.com)

*Tasks:*
 Define node state models (idle, active, processing, consensus)
 Design node configuration schema (JSON)
 Create node lifecycle management
 Define inter-node communication protocol
 Design node panel UI/UX mockups

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 Architecture document complete
 Node configuration schema defined
 UI mockups approved
 Communication protocol specified

*Objective:* Implement Channel Nodes for message routing and network communication.

*Features:*
 Message queue management
 Routing logic
 Load balancing across validators
 Real-time status updates
 Panel visualization (active connections, message rate)

*Technical Details:*
 WebSocket connections for real-time updates
 Message throughput tracking
 Connection pool management
 Status indicators (connected, routing, overload)

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 Channel nodes route messages correctly
 Real-time panel shows message flow
 Load balancing works across nodes
 Status updates in <100ms
